00019 #define OP_TESTCONN   1
00020 #define OP_EMPTYDB    2
00021 #define OP_FIND       3
00022 #define OP_POPULATE   4
00023

00026 void find(fsal_posixdb_conn *p_conn);

00038 
00039 void populatedb(fsal_posixdb_conn *p_conn, char *path)
00040 {
00041   int                     rc;
00042   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t info;
00043   fsal_name_t             fsalname;
00044   fsal_handle_t           handle, handle_parent;
00045   struct stat             buffstat;
00046   char                    * begin, * end, backup;
00047   
00048   if (path[0] != '/') {
00049       fputs("Error : you should provide a complete path", stderr);
00050       return;
00051   }
00052   
00053   if (path[strlen(path)-1] != '/' ) 
00054     strcat(path, "/");
00055 
00056   /* add the path (given in arguments) to the database */
00057   rc = lstat("/", &buffstat);
00058   fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo( &buffstat, &info );
00059   fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_conn, NULL, &info, NULL, &handle_parent);
00060 
00061   begin = end = path;
00062   while (*end != '\0') {
00063     while ( *begin == '/' ) begin++;
00064     if (*begin == '\0') break;
00065     end = begin + 1 ;
00066     while ( *end != '/' && *end != '\0') end++;
00067     backup = *end;
00068     *end = '\0';
00069     
00070     rc = lstat(path, &buffstat);
00071     fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo( &buffstat, &info );
00072     FSAL_str2name(begin, FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN, &fsalname);
00073     fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_conn, &fsalname, &info, &handle_parent, &handle);
00074     memcpy(&handle_parent, &handle, sizeof(fsal_handle_t));
00075     
00076     *end = backup;
00077     begin=end;
00078   }
00079 
00080   /* add files */
00081   printf("Adding entries in %s... ", path);
00082   fflush(stdout);
00083   add_dir( p_conn, path, &handle_parent );
00084   puts("done");
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 void add_dir(fsal_posixdb_conn *p_conn, char *path, fsal_handle_t *p_dir_handle) {
00089   DIR *dirp;
00090   struct dirent *dp;
00091   struct dirent dpe;
00092   fsal_handle_t new_handle;
00093   struct stat buffstat;
00094   char path_temp[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00095   fsal_status_t st;
00096   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t info;
00097   fsal_name_t fsalname;
00098 
00099   if ( (dirp = opendir(path)) ) {
00100     while (!readdir_r(dirp, &dpe, &dp) && dp)
00101     {
00102       if (!strcmp(dp->d_name, ".") || !strcmp(dp->d_name, "..")) continue;
00103       if (!strcmp(dp->d_name, ".snapshot")) {
00104             fputs("(ignoring .snapshot)", stderr);
00105             continue;
00106       }
00107       strcpy(path_temp, path);
00108       strcat(path_temp, dp->d_name);
00109       lstat(path_temp, &buffstat);
00110 
00111       fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo( &buffstat, &info );
00112       FSAL_str2name(dp->d_name, FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN, &fsalname);
00113       st = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_conn, &fsalname, &info, p_dir_handle, &new_handle);
00114       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st)) {
00115         fprintf(stderr, "[Error %i/%i]\n", st.major, st.minor);
00116         return;
00117       }
00118       if (S_ISDIR(buffstat.st_mode)) {
00119         strcat(path_temp, "/");
00120         add_dir( p_conn, path_temp, &new_handle );
00121       }
00122     };
00123     closedir(dirp);
00124   }
00125 }

00128 void emptydb( fsal_posixdb_conn *p_conn )
00129 {
00130   fsal_posixdb_status_t st;
00131   
00132   st = fsal_posixdb_flush(p_conn);
00133   if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(st)) {
00134     fprintf(stderr, "Error (%i/%i) while emptying the database\n", st.major, st.minor);
00135   } else {
00136     printf("Database entries have been successfully deleted\n");
00137   }
00138   
00139   return;
00140 }
00141   
00142 void find(fsal_posixdb_conn *p_conn)
00143 {
00144   fsal_handle_t             handle_root;
00145   fsal_posixdb_status_t     st;
00146   
00147   st = fsal_posixdb_getInfoFromName(  p_conn,
00148                                       NULL, /* parent handle */
00149                                       NULL, /* filename */
00150                                       NULL,  /* path */
00151                                       &handle_root);
00152   if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_NOENT(st)) {
00153     fputs("Error : Root handle not found. Is the database empty ?", stderr);
00154     return;
00155   } else if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(st)) {
00156     fprintf(stderr, "Error (%i/%i) while getting root handle\n", st.major, st.minor);
00157     return;
00158   }
00159   
00160   display_directory(p_conn, &handle_root, "");
00161   return;
00162 }
00163 
00164 void display_directory(fsal_posixdb_conn * p_conn, fsal_handle_t * p_handle_parent, char * basedir)
00165 {
00166     fsal_posixdb_child *p_children;
00167     fsal_posixdb_status_t st;
00168     unsigned int count, i;
00169     
00170     st = fsal_posixdb_getChildren(p_conn, p_handle_parent, 0, &p_children, &count);
00171     if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(st)) {
00172       fprintf(stderr, "Error (%i/%i) while getting children of %s\n", st.major, st.minor, basedir);
00173       return;
00174     }
00175     for (i=0; i<count; i++) {
00176       printf("%llu %s/%s\n",p_children[i].handle.info.inode,basedir, p_children[i].name.name);
00177       if (p_children[i].handle.info.ftype == FSAL_TYPE_DIR) {
00178         char basedir_new[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00179         strncpy(basedir_new, basedir, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00180         strncat(basedir_new, "/", FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00181         strncat(basedir_new, p_children[i].name.name, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00182         display_directory(p_conn, &(p_children[i].handle), basedir_new);
00183       }
00184     }
00185     Mem_Free(p_children);
00186 }

00189 int main(int argc, char ** argv)
00190 {
00191   fsal_posixdb_conn_params_t  dbparams;
00192   char                        exec_name[MAXPATHLEN];
00193   char                        c, op=0;
00194   fsal_posixdb_conn           *p_conn;
00195   fsal_posixdb_status_t       statusdb;
00196   char                        path[MAXPATHLEN];
00197   int rc;
00198   
00199   char  options[] = "h@H:P:L:D:K:" ;
00200   char  usage[] = 
00201     "Usage: %s [-h][-H <host>][-P <port>][-L <login>][-D <dbname>][-K <passwd file>] operation operation_parameters\n"
00202     "\t[-h]               display this help\n"
00203     "\t[-H <host>]        Database host\n"
00204     "\t[-P <port>]        Database port\n"
00205     "\t[-L <login>]       Database login\n"
00206     "\t[-D <dbname>]      Name of the database\n"
00207     "\t[-K <passwd file>] Path of the file where is stored the password\n"
00208     "------------- Default Values -------------\n"
00209     "host        : localhost\n"
00210     "port        : default DB port\n"
00211     "dbname      : posixdb\n"
00212     "login       : current unix user\n"
00213     "passwd file : default path ($PGPASSFILE)\n" 
00214     "------------- Operations -----------------\n"
00215     "test_connection       : try to connect to the database\n"
00216     "empty_database        : Delete all entries in the database\n"
00217     "find                  : Print the entries of the database (as 'find' would do it)\n"
00218     "populate <path>       : Add (recursively) the object in <path> into the database\n\n";
00219 
00220   memset(&dbparams, 0, sizeof(fsal_posixdb_conn_params_t));
00221   strcpy(dbparams.host, "localhost");
00222   strcpy(dbparams.dbname, "posixdb");
00223 
00224   /* What is the executable file's name */
00225   if( *exec_name == '\0' )
00226     strcpy( (char *)exec_name, basename(argv[0]) ) ;
00227   
00228   /* now parsing options with getopt */
00229   while( ( c = getopt( argc, argv, options ) ) != EOF ) {
00230       switch( c ) {
00231         case '@':
00232           /* A litlle backdoor to keep track of binary versions */
00233           printf( "%s compiled on %s at %s\n", exec_name, __DATE__, __TIME__ ) ;
00234           exit( 0 ) ;
00235           break ;
00236         case 'H':
00237           strncpy( dbparams.host, optarg, FSAL_MAX_DBHOST_NAME_LEN );
00238           break;
00239         case 'P':
00240           strncpy( dbparams.port, optarg, FSAL_MAX_DBPORT_STR_LEN );
00241           break;
00242         case 'L':
00243           strncpy( dbparams.login, optarg, FSAL_MAX_DB_LOGIN_LEN );
00244           break;
00245         case 'D':
00246           strncpy( dbparams.dbname, optarg, FSAL_MAX_DB_NAME_LEN );
00247           break;
00248         case 'K':
00249           strncpy( dbparams.passwdfile, optarg, PATH_MAX );
00250           break;
00251         default:
00252           /* display the help */
00253           fprintf( stderr, usage, exec_name ) ;
00254           exit( 0 ) ;
00255           break ;
00256       }
00257   }
00258   
00259   if (optind == argc) {
00260     fprintf(stderr, "No operation specified.\n"); 
00261     fprintf( stderr, usage, exec_name ) ;
00262     exit(0); 
00263   }
00264   if (optind < argc) {
00265      if ( !strcmp(argv[optind], "test_connection") ) {
00266        op = OP_TESTCONN;
00267      } else if ( !strcmp(argv[optind], "empty_database") ) {
00268        op = OP_EMPTYDB;
00269      } else if ( !strcmp(argv[optind], "find") ) {
00270        op = OP_FIND;
00271      } else if ( !strcmp(argv[optind], "populate") ) {
00272        op = OP_POPULATE;
00273        optind++;
00274         if (optind < argc) {
00275           strncpy(path, argv[optind], MAXPATHLEN);
00276         } else {
00277           fputs("Operation 'populate' need a parameter", stderr);
00278           fprintf( stderr, usage, exec_name ) ;
00279           exit( -1 ) ;
00280         }
00281      } else {
00282        fprintf (stderr, "Unknown operation : %s\n", argv[optind]);
00283         fprintf( stderr, usage, exec_name ) ;
00284        exit( -1 );
00285      }
00286  } 
00287 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00288   BuddyInit( NULL );  
00289 #endif  
00290   
00291   /* Connecting to database */
00292   if (*(dbparams.passwdfile) != '\0') {
00293     rc = setenv("PGPASSFILE", dbparams.passwdfile, 1);
00294     if (rc != 0)
00295       fputs("Could not set POSTGRESQL keytab path.", stderr);
00296   }
00297   
00298   fprintf(stderr, "Opening database connection to %s...\n", dbparams.host);
00299   statusdb = fsal_posixdb_connect(&dbparams, &p_conn);
00300   if (FSAL_POSIXDB_IS_ERROR(statusdb)) {
00301     fprintf(stderr, "Error %i. exiting.\n", statusdb.minor);
00302     exit(-1);
00303   } else {
00304     fprintf(stderr, "Connected.\n");
00305   }
00306   
00307   /* Execute the operation */
00308   switch( op ) {
00309     case OP_TESTCONN:
00310       /* nothing to do */
00311       break;
00312     case OP_EMPTYDB:
00313       emptydb( p_conn );
00314       break;
00315     case OP_FIND:
00316       find( p_conn );
00317       break;
00318     case OP_POPULATE:
00319       populatedb(p_conn, path);
00320       break;
00321     default:
00322       puts("Bad operation !!"); 
00323       fprintf( stderr, usage, exec_name ) ;
00324   }
00325   
00326   fsal_posixdb_disconnect(p_conn);
00327   
00328   exit(0);
00329 }
